page.title: 14WRITTLE, HYLANDS PARK
page.content: Hylands Park is not really in the grid that we have to study but it forms a central part in the recreational and social lif of the village so we have decided to include it as one of our pages of text. Hylands mansion and its 433 acres of parkland lie on the outskirts of Writtle, but the mansion itself is now in a dreadful state of decay. The house was built in 1728 for Sir John Comyns who was member of parliament for Maldon. The house has had a number of owners since it was first built. The present owners are the Borough of Chelmsford, and there are a number of suggestions for its future use, one of which is to turn it into a municipal golf course.
